page.title: 16India Mill Chimney
page.content: The old square stacks of the Lancashire cotton towns were associated with dark satanic mills but this certainly could not be said of India Mill Chimney,one of Darwen's most prominant land marks. The chimney took 4 years to build being finished in 1867.It is built in the style of a Venetian bell tower & the cost was Â£14,000.The foundation stone was a solid piece of ashlar,which was pulled to its resting place by a team of 30 horses.On this foundation was built a 14 metre high,square,stone pedestal with massive 12 metre long stone cornices.The chimney shaft was 8 metre square & was raised to a height of 85 metres above ground level.During World War 2 the ornamental iron cresting was removed for scrap.It weighed 20 tons & was made up of 30 castings.
